results.title: The Genie from down under: customs
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Swan, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Penelope, Lady Diana and Miss Mossop are arrested by a Customs Officer when they return to England with 20 million pounds provided by the genies. That exact amount has just gone missing from the Royal Mint.

results.title: The Gay divorcee
results.creator_credit: Mark Sandrich and Pandro S. Berman
results.brief_description: Adapted from the 1932 Cole Porter musical. The plot of “The Gay Divorcee”, rooted in mistaken identity is delightful. The script is sophisticated and bright and the cast is impeccable for comedy of this nature. Comparable to the best of Busby Berkeley and the most ingenious ballets of Gene Kelly, The Continental” dance routine is sufficient to turn “The Gay Divorcee into one of your most thrilling musical experiences. Stars Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers.

results.title: Letters home
results.brief_description: Sue’s great grandfather, Elisha Morgan, fought in the American Civil War but today all the family has left are three photographs, some letters, an obituary and a sword.

results.title: Just us
results.brief_description: Karli and Elmo grew up together. They went to the same schools, shared good times and bad times, and when things went wrong, there was always each other.

results.title: The Gauntlet
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Robert Daley, Malpaso Company and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood runs ‘The Gauntlet’ into an explosive piece of movie making that lives up to its title with a vengeance. He plays a burnt out Phoenix cop on an assignment to bring back from Las Vegas a ‘nothing witness for a nothing trial’ (Locke) which seems just another meaningless task in a meaningless life. Until the fireworks start! Trapped by treachery on both sides of the law, the two are forced through a deadly obstacle course of raging gunfire, blazing cars, swooping helicopters, murderous ambushes, crazed bikers and crooked police. With non-stop action and special effects that will blast you to the back of your seat, including a ferocious finale in which an armoured bus is shot to smithereens with more than 8,000 bullets (8000 bullets and none hit the tyres!). Leave the driving to Eastwood, sit back and enjoy the ride.

results.title: The Gee whiz graph (NP)
results.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Antony Jay and Video Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “How to Lie with Statistics”.
John Cleese narrates the first of a series of animated cartoons based on the book by Darrell Huff and Irving Geis. Concentrates on the suppression of zero, and the change of scale in graphs. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Inside outside...inside out
results.brief_description: Kristie remembers her childhood and teenage years as unhappy ones, of abuse and internal struggle. But at age 19, her life began to turn around through three very special people - Linda, Liz and Penny.
